001package com.scivicslab.pojoactor;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.List;
005import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
006import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
007import java.util.concurrent.Executors;
008import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
009import java.util.logging.Level;
010import java.util.logging.Logger;
011import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.pojo.Root;
012
013
014/**
015 * A lightweight actor system implementation that manages actor lifecycles and thread pools.
016 * This system provides a framework for creating and managing actors with concurrent message processing.
017 * 
018 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
019 * @version 1.0.0
020 */
021public class ActorSystem {
022
023    /*
024     * This class is composed of the following categories:
025     *
026     * - Fields and Constructors: Includes class fields and constructors.
027     * - Advanced APIs: Provides methods for specialized tasks.
028     * - Primitive APIs: Offers basic operations and data processing methods.
029     * - Setter/Getter methods: Provides functionality for setting and getting field values.
030     */
031
032
033    // =======================================================================
034    // Fields and Constructors/Destructors
035    // =======================================================================
036
037    private static Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(ActorSystem.class.getName());
038
039    protected String systemName;
040    
041    /**  A name to an ActorRef correspondance. */
042    protected ConcurrentHashMap<String, ActorRef<?>> actors = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
043
044
045    protected List<ExecutorService> workStealingPools = new ArrayList<>();
046
047    
048    /**
049     * Builder class for creating ActorSystem instances with custom configurations.
050     */
051    public static class Builder {
052        String systemName = "unnamed";
053        int threadNum = 1;
054
055        /**
056         * Constructs a new Builder with the specified system name.
057         * 
058         * @param systemName the name for the actor system
059         */
060        public Builder(String systemName) {
061            this.systemName = systemName;
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Sets the number of threads for the actor system.
066         * 
067         * @param num the number of threads to use
068         * @return this builder instance for method chaining
069         */
070        public Builder threadNum(int num) {
071            this.threadNum = num;
072            return this;
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Builds and returns a new ActorSystem instance.
077         * 
078         * @return a new ActorSystem with the configured settings
079         */
080        public ActorSystem build() {
081            ActorSystem system = new ActorSystem(systemName, threadNum);
082            return system;
083        }
084    }
085
086
087
088    
089    /**
090     * Constructs an ActorSystem with the specified name and default thread pool.
091     * 
092     * @param systemName the name of the actor system
093     */
094    public ActorSystem(String systemName) {
095        this.systemName = systemName;
096        this.workStealingPools.add(Executors.newWorkStealingPool());
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Constructs an ActorSystem with the specified name and thread count.
101     * 
102     * @param systemName the name of the actor system
103     * @param threadNum the number of threads in the work stealing pool
104     */
105    public ActorSystem(String systemName, int threadNum) {
106        this.systemName = systemName;
107        this.workStealingPools.add(Executors.newWorkStealingPool(threadNum));
108    }
109
110
111
112    
113    /**
114     * Terminates the actor system by closing all actors and shutting down thread pools.
115     * Waits up to 60 seconds for graceful termination.
116     */
117    public void terminate() {
118        actors.keySet().stream()
119            .forEach((name)->actors.get(name).close());
120
121        this.workStealingPools.stream()
122            .forEach((pool)->{
123                    pool.shutdownNow();
124                    try {
125                        if (!pool.awaitTermination(60, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {
126                            logger.log(Level.WARNING, "Pool did not terminate");
127                        }
128                    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
129                        logger.log(Level.WARNING, "InterruptedException occurred while waiting for the pool to terminate.");
130                    }
131                });
132    }
133
134
135    
136    // =======================================================================
137    // High level APIs
138    // =======================================================================
139
140    
141    /**
142     * Creates a new actor with the specified name and object.
143     * 
144     * @param <T> the type of the actor object
145     * @param actorName the unique name for the actor
146     * @param object the object that will handle messages for this actor
147     * @return a reference to the created actor
148     */
149    public <T> ActorRef<T> actorOf(String actorName, T object) {
150        ActorRef<T> actor = new ActorRef<T>(actorName, object, this);
151        actors.put(actorName, actor);
152        return actor;
153    }
154
155    
156    /**
157     * Adds an existing actor to the system with the specified name.
158     * 
159     * @deprecated Use {@link #addActor(ActorRef)} instead
160     * @param <T> the type of the actor object
161     * @param actorName the name to associate with the actor
162     * @param actor the actor reference to add
163     * @return the added actor reference
164     */
165    @Deprecated
166    public <T> ActorRef<T> addActor(String actorName, ActorRef<T> actor) {
167        actors.put(actorName, actor);
168        return actor;
169    }
170
171    /** Add the directly generated Actor to the ActorSystem.
172     *
173     * @param actor An ActorRef object to be added to the ActorSystem.
174     * @return The same ActorRef object as the argument.
175     */
176    public <T> ActorRef<T> addActor(ActorRef<T> actor) {
177        String actorName = actor.getName();
178        actors.put(actorName, actor);
179        return actor;
180    }
181
182    
183    /** Add the directly generated Actor to the ActorSystem while changing the name used within the ActorSystem.
184     *
185     * @param actor An ActorRef object to be added to the ActorSystem.
186     * @param actorName A name to be associated with the ActorRef object.
187     * @return The same ActorRef object as the argument.
188     */
189    public <T> ActorRef<T> addActor(ActorRef<T> actor, String actorName) {
190        actors.put(actorName, actor);
191        return actor;
192    }
193
194
195    /** Add a new WorkStealingPool to the ActorSystem.
196     *
197     * @param threadNum The number of threads in the WorkStealingPool.
198     * @return true if the WorkStealingPool is successfully added to the ActorSystem.
199     */
200    /**
201     * Adds a new work stealing pool to the actor system.
202     * 
203     * @param threadNum the number of threads in the new pool
204     * @return true if the pool was successfully added
205     */
206    public boolean addWorkStealingPool(int threadNum) {
207        return this.workStealingPools.add(Executors.newWorkStealingPool(threadNum));
208    }
209
210
211    /**
212     * Checks if an actor with the specified name exists in the system.
213     * 
214     * @param actorName the name of the actor to check
215     * @return true if the actor exists, false otherwise
216     */
217    public boolean hasActor(String actorName) {
218        return this.actors.containsKey(actorName);
219    }
220
221
222    /**
223     * Initializes the system logger with the specified name.
224     * 
225     * @param loggerName the name for the logger
226     */
227    public void initLogger(String loggerName) {
228        logger = Logger.getLogger(loggerName);
229    }
230
231
232    /**
233     * Checks if the actor system is alive (no thread pools are shut down).
234     * 
235     * @return true if the system is alive, false otherwise
236     */
237    public boolean isAlive() {
238        for (int i=0; i<workStealingPools.size(); i++) {
239            if (workStealingPools.get(i).isShutdown()) {
240                return false;
241            }
242        }
243        return true;
244    }
245
246
247    /**
248     * Checks if a specific actor is alive.
249     * 
250     * @param actorName the name of the actor to check
251     * @return true if the actor exists and is alive, false otherwise
252     */
253    public boolean isAlive(String actorName) {
254        if (actors.get(actorName) == null) {
255            return false;
256        }
257        else if (actors.get(actorName).isAlive()) {
258            return true;
259        }
260        else {
261            return false;
262        }
263    }    
264    
265
266    /**
267     * Returns a list of all actor names in the system.
268     * 
269     * @return a list containing the names of all actors
270     */
271    public List<String> listActorNames() {
272        return new ArrayList<String>(actors.keySet());
273    }
274
275
276    
277    /**
278     * Removes an actor from the system.
279     * 
280     * @param actorName the name of the actor to remove
281     */
282    public void removeActor(String actorName) {
283        actors.remove(actorName);
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Returns the root actor of the system.
288     * 
289     * @deprecated Use {@link #getActor(String)} with "ROOT" instead
290     * @return the root actor reference
291     */
292    @Deprecated
293    public ActorRef<Root> root() {
294        return this.getActor("ROOT");
295    }
296
297    // =======================================================================
298    // Primitive APIs
299    // =======================================================================
300
301
302    /**
303     * Returns a string representation of the actor system.
304     * 
305     * @return a string containing the system name
306     */
307    public String toString() {
308        return String.format("{actorSystem: \"%s\"}", systemName);
309    }
310
311
312    // =======================================================================
313    // Setter/Getter methods
314    // =======================================================================
315
316    /**
317     * Sets the logger for the actor system.
318     * 
319     * @param logger the logger instance to use
320     */
321    public void setLogger(Logger logger) {
322        this.logger = logger;
323    }
324
325
326    
327    /**
328     * Gets the current logger instance.
329     * 
330     * @return the current logger
331     */
332    public Logger getLogger() {
333        return logger;
334    }
335
336
337    /**
338     * Retrieves an actor by name.
339     * 
340     * @param <T> the type of the actor object
341     * @param actorName the name of the actor to retrieve
342     * @return the actor reference, or null if not found
343     */
344    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
345    public <T> ActorRef<T> getActor(String actorName) {
346        return (ActorRef<T>)actors.get(actorName);
347    }
348
349
350    
351    /** Returns the default workStealingPool of the ActorSystem.
352     *
353     * @return The default workStealingPool of the ActorSystem (the 0th workStealingPool).
354     */
355    /**
356     * Returns the default work stealing pool of the actor system.
357     * 
358     * @return the default work stealing pool (index 0)
359     */
360    public ExecutorService getWorkStealingPool() {
361        return this.workStealingPools.get(0);
362    }
363
364    /**
365     * Returns a work stealing pool at the specified index.
366     * 
367     * @param n the index of the work stealing pool to return
368     * @return the work stealing pool at the specified index
369     */
370    public ExecutorService getWorkStealingPool(int  n) {
371        return this.workStealingPools.get(n);
372    }
373
374
375    
376}
